TEXT.English: Infused Ash
TEXT.German: Geklärte Asche
TEXT.Italian: Cenere Infusa
TEXT.Spanish: Infused Ash

TEXT.English: The Legion is known for burning almost all substances down into ash, letting the mages of D'tesh use it in their fell experiments. The sheer destruction required to make such material in quantity is the most potent example of the Legion's inimicality to all life on Creation.
TEXT.French: La Légion est connue pour sa propension à brûler la quasi-totalité des substances, permettant ainsi aux mages de D'tesh d'en utiliser les cendres dans leurs sombres expériences.
TEXT.German: Die Legion ist dafür bekannt, dass sie nahezu alles zu Asche verbrennen wird. Daraus können die Magier der D'tesh dann für ihrer seltsamen Experimente Nutzen ziehen.
TEXT.Italian: La Legione è conosciuta per bruciare quasi tutte le sostanze in cenere, permettendo ai maghi di D'tesh di usarla per i loro crudeli esperimenti.

TEXT.English: Bison
TEXT.French: Bison
TEXT.German: Bison
TEXT.Italian: Bisonte
TEXT.Spanish: Bison

TEXT.English: In the colder parts of Erebus, cattle herding is prohibitively challenging, as the biting cold leaves little for them to forage. Instead, the people eking out an existence in those places elect to hunt the hardy, willful Bison to sustain themselves. But while any typical settlement can exploit the bounty of a Bison in a crafty fashion, the Doviello go one step further: some of them tame these beasts and use them as fearsome mounts. Even the knights of the Hippus are wary of charging at a pack of Bison Riders.
TEXT.French: Les Bisons naissent sans leur bosse et leurs cornes reconnaissables, et vivent environ 20 ans. Ils atteignent l'âge adulte vers deux ou trois ans, même si les mâles continuent de grandir jusqu'à leur 7 ans. Les mâles expriment une forte tendance à la bagarre à la domination durant la saison des amours. Le Bison mâle se bat souvent pour les femelles et ces luttes se terminent souvent pour des blessures ou la mort. Après l'accouplement, le troupeau se sépare en troupeaux plus réduits. Les femelles vêlent 9 mois plus tard, et s'occupent et nourissent leurs petits pour un an. Les Bisons mâles peuvent atteindre 3,5 m de long et 2 m au garrot, et peuvent peser jusqu'à 1100 kg.

Even the knights of the Hippus are wary of charging at a pack of Bison Riders.
TEXT.Italian: I bisonti nascono senza la loro caratteristice gobbe e corni e possono vivere per circa 20 anni. Diventano adulti intorno ai 2-3 anni, nonostante ciò i maschi continuano a crescere sino al loro settimo anno. I bisonti maschi adulti diventano particolarmente competitivi per il dominio durante la stagione degli accoppiamenti. Spesso questi scontri per le femmini si concludono con ferite o addirittura la morte. Dopo che si accoppiano la mandira principale si divide in mandrie più piccole. I vitelli nascono 9 mesi dopo l'accoppiamento e le madri si prendono cura del piccolo per un anno intero. I bisonti maschi possono arrivare ad essere lunghi 3.5m e alti, alla spalla, 2m e pesare sino ai 998 kg.

TEXT.English: Bleeding God Wine
TEXT.French: Vin des Dieux Hémophiles
TEXT.German: Bleeding God Wine
TEXT.Italian: Bleeding God Wine
TEXT.Spanish: Bleeding God Wine

TEXT.English: Bleeding Gods were once sea giants used by Danalin to defend his islands during the Godswar. But since Danalin has gone mad they have followed. Now these great towering creatures swim through the ocean eternally bleeding. Turning the water red in their wake, and usually shadowed by a herd of equally crazed sharks. The "Gods" bear little direct ill will toward humanity but will occasionally lash out at a ship, tearing it to pieces and dumping the sailors into the ocean where the sharks wait.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Bleeding God wine, said to be from the bloody water these creatures have passed through, is dangerous to gather and highly valued by the Balseraphs, and is said to cause madness. Patrian Mages used it ritually in sacrifices to Agares.

TEXT.Italian: Cammello

TEXT.English: Unlike the rest of Erebus, the Malakim have a more eclectic choice of mount: the hardy camel. Able to go on for days without food or drink, it is the staple of every wandering merchant going through the desert to ensure his people remain connected and well-supplied. The more martial of them also find them just as adept as horses in warfare - none can boast mounts as fierce and hearty as the Hippus, but even they are forced to concede to the Malakim when it comes to the best steed for desert warfare.

TEXT.English: Cotton
TEXT.French: Coton
TEXT.German: Baumwolle
TEXT.Italian: Cotone
TEXT.Spanish: Algodón

TEXT.English: No cash crop on Erebus is as ubiquitous as Cotton. Khazad and Mechanos have invented machines to harvest it en masse, and the Calabim work their subjects to death to fill the coffers of their cruel masters. What lacks in quality, it more than makes up in sheer quantity: alongside spinning machines, clothes can be produced at a prodigious rate, a mark of ingenuity by Kandros Fir's economic acumen and a protective weapon by the godless Mechanos against anyone too offended by their beliefs. Protectionist policies by even the goodliest nations most often target cotton to prevent any of the three from destroying their domestic tailoring industry.

TEXT.English: While one of many staples among the Lanun, other nations consider it more of a delicacy. Along the Lanun, it is often a custom for one to make a deep dive in the seas, and collect as many as possible before having to go to the surface for air - the one with the biggest number gets free drinks from his buddies for the day. And a few species of clam are known for their lustrous pearls, to the point it's one of the most lucrative trades among many a Lanun captain. One necklace made by pearls from a species of clam cultivated by Undertow Cultists is one of Hannah the Irin's most treasured possessions.

TEXT.English: In the Age of Rebirth, various nations had to relearn how to smelt and work metal. In the beginning, they started with Copper; its ease of use in those grueling early days meant troops could be fielded with weapons much easier than having to dig into dangerous ruins for remains from the Age of Magic. But once Iron became easier to forge, Copper immediately fell to the wayside. The Khazad, in particular, boast the ability to make Dagian Bronze, a metal able to conduct light throughout its surface. Its long ribbons go from above ground, collecting light to illuminate their vast underground cities.

TEXT.English: More common among the expansive plains of Erebus, Corn is a common crop amongst the Hippus and Chislev. Its wilder form is also highly regarded amongst the Fey; elven corn is not as edible among the rest of Erebus, but Fey cuisine uses it as an ingredient for everything from everyday staples to the most luxurious of delicacies. One dish using a variant of wild corn is Arendel's favorite dish, to the point mastering it is a requirement for being a royal chef. And to Faeryl's glee, more than one Svartalfar spy managed this feat.

TEXT.English: Crab does not just denote only that: it also denotes other crustaceans like lobsters. Lanun in particular have perfected the art of preparing lobsters - keeping the lobster from rotting quickly after death is a closely kept secret by many captains leery of landlubbers competing for their food of choice. But even crabs are seen as a delicacy to more terrestrial nations looking for variety in their cuisine.

TEXT.English: To the Fey, this is the sacred animal of Sucellus. The famed Fyrdwell even use them as steed in times of war, their bond with them so strong, it overpowers their otherwise-skittish natures. But to everyone else, they're simply the quintessential animal one hunts. Most simply hunt deer for food and pelt, but a few yearn for more. Many a hunter has taken the task of hunting the great stags of a former age, an age of plenty where nature was more vicious yet also nurturing, an age where agriculture didn't exist yet. In the quintessential animal to hunt, a more primal history is there for the willing to once again partake in.

TEXT.English: Of the many sources of Dye exploited and even created in the Age of Magic, few survive to this day. The harsh Age of Ice wiped out many species of dye-providing plants and shells, making certain colors so highly sought after as to be compared to gold. And of the various nations of Erebus, none demand unique dyes more than the Balseraphs, to the point their dye industry eclipses everyone else's. From painters to tailors to even mages performing select rituals, the Balseraphs have cornered this market in providing that resource, and the Momus is more than glad to abuse it as an economic weapon at his whim...

And of the various nations of Erebus, none demand unique dyes more than the Balseraphs, to the point their dye industry eclipses everyone else's. From painters to tailors to even mages performing select rituals, the Balseraphs have cornered this market in providing that resource, and the Momus is more than glad to abuse it as an economic weapon at his whim...

TEXT.English: As one Grigori adventurer once joked, the Lanun have two staples: fish and shrimp. Even to non-Lanun nations, fish are the staple seafood for any coastal city on Erebus, coming in many variants, each unique in its own way. But Lanun have a special relationship: no other nation can boast to have as many marine dishes as them. And many captains are adept enough that they can go for weeks without touching shore by simply subsisting on the bounty of the sea around them. Mordmorgan, in particular, considers it a point of pride to only go to shore for water, rum, and enough fruits to keep the threat of scurvy at bay.

TEXT.English: In settlements deep in colder climates, cotton and silk are not enough. The only way to combat the cold in such places is via the furs of animals they can hunt. Fur can come in many shapes: mink, beaver, rabbit. And once treated via tanning, they provide comfort against even the harshest conditions. The Doviello, in particular, have a savage custom: being given thick clothes by another is a mark of weakness. To gain respect, one must go into the wilderness and fight a predatory animal to the death, then use its hide to sew her own clothes. Lucian, in particular, has a coat made from a dire wolf he slew while he was young.

TEXT.English: Highly sought after for their beauty and value, gemstones are ubiquitous throughout all but the most savage cultures. Nobles from all over Creation adorn themselves with them; priests of Kilmorph decorate their temples in masterful craftsmanship to honor their Earthmother; and arcane researches know by heart which type of gem is best suited for which ritual. But the especially esoterically-minded among the Emrys see them in a different way: they see the stars Ceridwen adorns herself with, a pale reflection of the Gems of Creation Agares stole, a kaleidoscope of possibilities constrained by Creation's imprisoning nature.

TEXT.English: The first horses were domesticated by the people that would become the Hippus shortly after the Compact was signed. Since then, they have become synonymous with the nomadic-herder people: when anyone on Erebus thinks of mounted warfare, they think of the horselords. But equine tradition is not exclusive to the Hippus - many a messenger relied on his steed to take a message from one place to the next, and carriages would never be possible without them. And in the Age of Magic, horse was sewn together with man by the disciples of Kezef and Leucetios to create the centaurs.

TEXT.English: From consecration to profaning, incense has been a staple of various priests throughout Creation. The fragrance released via burning it is a crucial part for any religious ceremony or ritual - Elder Methyl of the Luonnotar has theorized that it helps make the minds of participants more susceptible to divine meddling, in continuing their childish spat against one another. The Ashen Veil's ritualists, in particular, hand pick select incenses that erode the will of individuals, in preparation for demonic possession; whereas the Order and Empyrean pick herbs that aid in mental resilience and clarity, respectively.

TEXT.English: As the Age of Rebirth progressed, more and more knowledge got reclaimed. Among them was the knowledge to smelt and forge iron in great quantities. While slightly weaker than Bronze, Iron more than made up for this slight flaw in the volume in which weapons, armor, and other tools could be produced. And with various smiths perfecting the process of making steel, it gave birth to a new age of warfare. The Bannor could finally complement their discipline with mass amounts of equipment, allowing them to fight and conquer unlike any other nation.

TEXT.English: Even in the Age of Magic, the tusks and bones of elephants were highly sought after for large volumes of easily enchanted material. It is a sad fact that so many horrors happened during that age, the mass hunting of elephants and its mammoth sibling is just another entry on the list, too unimportant to take note in a relative sense. In that vein, the Age of Ice was a blessing in disguise - it finally allowed these majestic animals to replenish their numbers, even if slightly. And in the Age of Rebirth, the Luchuirp use their bones to forge their most resilient creation yet: the Bone Golem.

TEXT.English: Since the beginning of the Age of Magic, pigs had been used for food, for leather, even as waste disposal. And in the Age of Rebirth, no nation found as much use for them as the Calabim. Perfecting the art of industrialized livestock farming, they treat their pig farms as cruelly as they do their breeding pits, valuing volume at all costs. A foul system of mutual synergy has become the norm: pig farms provide food to breeding pits, which in turn dispose their waste to the pig farms. Thankfully, other nations treat their livestock much less cruelly, though the Khazad have a weird fixation with using them as war mounts...

TEXT.English: Famed as much for its bounty as its labor intensity, rice is a staple for any settlement with the ability to irrigate constantly and the manpower required to harvest it. It is one of the two crops of the Dao, and most curiously, a beloved staple of the Cualli. The latter, in particular, employ a highly ritualistic farming process in service of their cruel God: slaves aren't just worked to death, but also bled in a most literal manner in the process. This massacre of their lessers seems to imbue their rice with a cursed quality, making it poisonous to any not sufficiently devoted to Aeron.

TEXT.English: First domesticated by the Hippus alongside horses, sheep remains their most valuable commodity even in the Age of Rebirth. They can be milked for dairy, sheared for clothing, and butchered for their meat. One traditional Hippus dish is a stew made from lamb offal, formerly eaten to celebrate the signing of the Compact, now made to celebrate the end of the Age of Ice. During this celebration, all hostilities between clans cease, and is often used as an opportunity for diplomacy. Shepherd parables are also ubiquitous among the Hippus, owing to their herding tradition unbroken since the Compact.

TEXT.English: Whether from silkworms or captured Giant Spiders, silk remains the most valuable fabric for the most luxurious clothing available. Its softness and durability, alongside its comfort in warm weather, make it sought after by all, and Kuriotate tailors often settle for nothing less than silk as their fabric of choice. Silken garments are the clothes of choice for monarchs and powerful aristocrats, and tyrian purple was the dye of choice in the Patrian Empire, a signifier of imperial authority. Kylorin and the Imprimatur Council in their signature attire commanded respect from even the rowdiest of citizenry.

TEXT.English: The bread and butter of all masons on Erebus, stone has been used to construct any building imaginable. From the most humble of homesteads, to the most elaborate of aqueduct systems, stone provides a level of integrity wood could never do. Temples of Kilmorph favor stone over more elaborate building materials, its use a deliberate choice to signify a grounded, down to earth mentality. But its simplicity belies a hidden versatility: rocks polished to a sheen and enchanted by a savvy Luchuirp craftsman are the basis for the dreaded Nullstone Golem, which deflects magic with contemptuous ease.

Most common in the jungles of Erebus, Sugar is a crucial ingredient for all kinds of pastries. The Elohim in particular make great efforts to secure shipments from their Mazatl allies in service of preserving Patrian culinary traditions, in addition to maintaining their unique cuisines. The orcs of the Clan of Embers, however, have a much cruder use of it: fermentation and distillation. Orcish alcohol is notorious for its extreme strength, and many are so brazen as to use it as fuel for incendiary attacks.
And in case anyone is stupid enough to try it: Valledia voided her stomach's contents after she did so. Stick to Khazad brewery. It's much less offensive to your body, and they have centuries of tradition backing their craftsmanship. Deruptus Ale is some of the finest in Creation!

TEXT.English: Before the Aifons met their mysterious demise, the whale was deemed sacred beyond all other animals by them. So valued it was, none dared risk their wrath hunting them even for curiosity. But since their disappearance and the arrival of Mulcarn, it quickly became the lifeline of a Lanun driven to the brink of destruction. After the snows receded, however, whaling has spread far beyond the Lanun, with various ne'er-do-weels lured by the sheer bounty of hunting such a massive marine animal, without the immense risks of hunting krakens and other terrifying fauna, some still mad by what they saw on the day the Aifons were wiped without a trace.

TEXT.English: No crop can claim to be as much of a staple on Erebus as Wheat. Such is its importance, even the followers of the Overlords refer to kelp as the "wheat of the seas". Every Grigori homestead allocates a portion of it for it; even the hard-headed Illians concede to the importance of agriculture, boasting a variant of it that can survive even the most frigid of weather. And Mechanos industrialized farming pumps out enough to feed even the Heavens they so despise. Perhaps the only ones who don't seem to care as much are the Khazad, their skill with mushroom farming being much better suited for underground conditions.

TEXT.English: The history of wine-making dates even before the signing of the Compact, with enterprising mortals cultivating and fermenting grapes for personal consumption. After the signing, however, wine-making blossomed into a highly-respected enterprise, used in celebration and relaxation both during the Age of Magic. But the Age of Ice has done irreparable damage to this tradition, with the Age of Rebirth still struggling to relearn the techniques discarded in favor of survival. Shockingly, it is the Bannor who are most famed for their vintage - a break from their militaristic and fanatical image that hints to an element that somehow survived extinction.

TEXT.English: Amongst the nations of Erebus, no fruit is as exotic as the Banana. Growing in the hot, humid jungles, the only places one can readily get them are the lands the Clan of Embers claim, alongside the Lizardmen civilizations. Prospecting Lanun waste no chance moving fresh produce from the Mazatl to goodly or neutral nations, while the Cualli take pride in making the Calabim Aristocracy rely on them and them alone for such a delicacy. But if one were to ask an orc, he'd burst into hysterics even insinuating it's a delicacy, before kicking your ass for being a snooty fop. Turns out, the orcs don't think it's anything special.

TEXT.English: A Letter on Cowing[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To my son Adonijah at the Nimarail School of the Arcane,[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]My son, I am writing to you to warn you of your future. Magic is a risky business! Too risky for a poor son of mine, I reckon. So I urge you to take up cowing instead. Im a cower, and I have earned a great deal of money through the business. Havent you ever wondered why I have such a nice home for all the cows?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cowings a respectable business, unlike that death magic stuff your learning. Why raise the dead when you can raise a cow? Cows dont hurt you; cows dont attempt to kill you like those skeletons do. And if you like the death part of death magic, then theres plenty of that in cowing, too! You even get to eat the cows you kill  or sell them for a profit. Dead cows are just as good as live cows, I say.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]With cows you can do countless things, unlike death magic. With death magic all you can do raise the dead or summon some spirits or become a lich. With cows you can eat them, milk them, sell them live, sell them dead, sell their milk, you can even sell the sick ones to Balseraph noblemen to use as projectiles. Also, they warn you of coming storms. Does death magic do all those things? I think not.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I urge you, Adonijah, to drop out of school and become a cower.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your loving father,[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Nikud

TEXT.French: Caribou
TEXT.German: Arktische Wildtiere
TEXT.Italian: Renna

TEXT.English: Common in colder climates, this breed of deer is much hardier than its more temperant counterparts. In the harsh Age of Ice, Arctic Deer were the lifeline of many a scattered tribe fighting for its survival, and were considered a delicacy amongst the savage Doviello. Even in the Age of Rebirth, crafty settlements know how to make the most out of its bounty, aiding in even productive endeavors.

TEXT.Spanish: Fruta de Yggdrasil

TEXT.English: The bounty of Yggdrasil is the finest of foods, said to offer increased strength and health to those that consume it. They grace the tables of kings and are offered to injured heroes to help speed their healing.
TEXT.French: Le don d'Yggdrasil est la plus fine des nourritures, supposée donner une plus grande force et une meilleure santé à ceux qui le consomment. Ils honorent les tables des rois et sont offerts aux héros blessés pour accélérer leur guérison.
TEXT.German: Die Gaben des Yggdrasil sind die feinste Nahrung. Angeblich verbessern sie die Kraft und Gesundheit derer, die sie essen. Diese Gaben schmücken die Tische der Könige und werden oft verletzten Helden angeboten, um deren Heilungsprozess zu beschleunigen.
TEXT.Italian: I frutti di Yggdrasil sono i più raffinati di tutti i cibi, si dice conferiscano forza e benessere a coloro che li mangiano. Sono presenti sulle tavole dei re e vengono offerti agli eroi feriti per aiutarli a guarire.
TEXT.Spanish: El don del Yggdrasil es el mejor de los alimentos, del que se dice que incrementa la fuerza y la vitalidad de aquellos que lo consumen. Adornan las mesas de los reyes y son ofrecidas a héroes heridos para acelerar su curación.

TEXT.English: Gulagarm
TEXT.French: Gulagarm
TEXT.German: Gulagarm
TEXT.Italian: Gulagarm
TEXT.Spanish: Gamogula

TEXT.English: [TAB]The innocent-looking berries are always ripe. But it is said that the soul of anyone who eats them will never be able to leave hell. And with the Infernals entering creation, that rumor proved itself horrifyingly true: popping up wherever hell's influence seeps into the earth, and anyone slain by blades coated with it finding themselves at the mercy of the great machine of hell. The faithful of the Ashen Veil often coat their blades with its juices, their kills in service of whichever demon lord they serve.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Ces baies innocentes sont toujours mûres. Mais on dit que l'âme de quiconque en mange ne pourra jamais quitter l'Enfer.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die unschuldigen Beeren sind immer reif. Aber man sagt wer sie ißt, dessen Seele kann die Hölle nicht mehr verlassen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Queste innocenti bacche sono sempre mature. Ma si dice che l'anima di chiunque le mangi non potrà mai abbandonare l'inferno.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Las bayas de los inocentes siempre están maduras. Pero se dice que el alma de todo aquel que las coma nunca podrá salir del infierno.

TEXT.English: Gunpowder
TEXT.French: Poudre à canon
TEXT.German: Schwarzpulver
TEXT.Italian: Polvere da Sparo
TEXT.Spanish: Pólvora

TEXT.English: Often known as Blasting Powder, Gunpowder is a new innovation of the Age of Rebirth, and some say it signals the coming of a new age without magic. It is commonly made with sulfur, but gunpowder made with Belrite (a rock that blows up when it comes into contact with fire) is even more highly sought after. The Mechanos, in particular, use their knowledge taken from the Khazad to great effect: the quality of their blasting powder is what gives their dreaded Howitzers their deadly efficiency, to the point even the Infernals are wary of the whistle of falling shells.
TEXT.French: Souvent appelée Poudre Explosive, la Poudre à Canon est une innovation de l'Âge de la Renaissance et certains disent qu'elle est annonciatrice d'un nouvel âge sans magie.
TEXT.German: Auch bekannt als "Sprengpulver" ist Schwarzpulver eine neue Erfindung des Zeitalters der Wiedergeburt, und manche denken, es würde ein neues Zeitalter der Magie einläuten.
TEXT.Italian: Spesso conosciuta come Polvere Esplosiva, la Polvere da Sparo è un'invenzione dell'Era della Rinascità, e si dice che segni l'inizio di una nuova era senza magia.
TEXT.Spanish: También conocida como Polvo Explosivo, la Pólvora es una nueva innovación de la Edad del Renacimiento, y hay quien dice que señala la llegada de una nueva edad sin magia.

TEXT.English: Jeteye
TEXT.French: Jeteye
TEXT.German: Jeteye
TEXT.Italian: Jeteye
TEXT.Spanish: Jeteye

TEXT.English: An addictive drug that sedates and can cause horrible hallucinations, it turn the entire iris and sclera of the user black. It is administered by squirting the liquid inside the eyelid.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Nether Blade is stored in the Bay of Laurus and Os-Gabella ends up traveling to the city to attempt to find it and use it to end her immortal life. Before she does so she discovers the Jeteye dealers of the cities ports and finds some measure of escape in the delusions and opiate dreams the drug offers. Somewhere among the cities beggars the first human lives in squaller, once queen of the Sheaim, once grandmother to the Calabim, once unwilling bride to the god Nemed, her world is now little more than visions and dancing shadows. More than one man seeking to abuse or hurt the cities beggars has met his end when he assumed Os-Gabella was just another broken vagrant.

TEXT.English: Air Mana
TEXT.French: Mana d'Air
TEXT.German: Mana der Luft
TEXT.Italian: Mana dell'Aria
TEXT.Spanish: Maná de Aire

TEXT.English:
"Why do I like Air Magic classes, you ask? Simple! There's no rigid curriculum! Our tutor is loads of fun too! Little written material, lots of winging it, you can ace this class by simply letting yourself go wild! Just don't get cheeky and do something like lift up girls' skirts. Tyr may just come at you and make you regret the fact you were born. Trust me, I saw it happen once. It's one of the few things I fear. Oh wait, I thought of something SUPER fun, lemme show you-" -Adept Morin
Air is the dominion of movement, speed and freedom. Though it is most commonly associated with the wind, adepts can frequently use the dominion to slip out of bonds, or race across an open field at great speed. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Practitioners, usually called Aeromancers, have overwhelming wanderlust. Imprisoning a practitioner will often cause them to go insane. Practitioners often find that their mood is impacted by the weather, powerful practitioners find that the weather is impacted by their mood. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable practitioners include Greysun, apprentice to Kylorin.

TEXT.French: Mana de Corps
TEXT.German: Mana des Körpers
TEXT.Italian: Mana del Corpo
TEXT.Spanish: Maná de Cuerpo

TEXT.English: [TAB][TAB]"Tyr's physique is... amazing. How does she manage it?" [TAB]"Oh, they didn't tell you? She's this Hall's tutor on Body Magic." [TAB][TAB]"Ahh... I hope she doesn't take it badly I can't help but stare at her." [TAB]"Ha, she doesn't mind, actually. She takes it as a point of pride. Just don't be a perv." [TAB][TAB]"Oh dear. Duly noted. Anything else I should beware?" [TAB]"First? She swings more towards her own sex. Second? Even if she humors your advances, you won't win her challenge. She'll fold you like paper." [TAB][TAB]"O- Others dared to!?" [TAB]"There's always an idiot who didn't learn the lesson the hard way. By Oghma, the infirmary always has an occupant due to this, hahaha!" [NEWLINE]-Adept Morin's younger brother, on an introductory tour by Morin [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE] The magic of blood, bone and flesh. There is little detection here, instead minor practitioners often have superhuman physical attributes. More advanced practitioners can apply these bonuses to others, or transform themselves completely. Some can change their face to mimic someone else, bend their bodies like a snake, or regrow lost limbs. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The strain of this magic on the body causes practitioners to die young. Many practitioners have physical defects that they can overcome with this dominion. Some practitioners can only affect their own body with this dominion, but these practitioners are often capable of incredible transformations. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable practitioners include Kezef, apprentice to Kylorin, who grafted himself into the body of a living Giant.

TEXT.English: Chaos Mana
TEXT.French: Mana de Chaos
TEXT.German: Mana des Chaos
TEXT.Italian: Mana del Caos
TEXT.Spanish: Maná de Caos

TEXT.English:
"Some of you may wonder why our restrictions on Chaos Magic are so stringent. Consider Loukas: as he grew in aptitude, the normally jovial attitude he exhibited changed into something malign. Erratic outbursts of violence. Willingness to harm others for the most inconsequential of reasons. Abusing his fortune to come out on top at the expense of everyone around him. By the time we realized we had a problem on our hands, it was too late: we saw him beating his own forcibly mutated protege into a pulp, with unhinged glee all over his face." -Principal Patrocle, on the trial and execution of Archmage Loukas
The power of chaos and randomness. Practitioners have little to no control over the outcome of their spells. They merely channel their power toward their target. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Practitioners are usually immune to the effect of their own spells and the influence of this dominion. Instead their influence usually impacts those around them, often unintentionally. Accidents are more common, and others are more apt to take rash actions. Many practitioners are gamblers, not because this dominion helps them, instead it negatively impacts those gambling against them. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable practitioners include Carnivean, apprentice to Kylorin.

"Some of you may wonder why our restrictions on Chaos Magic are so stringent. Consider Loukas: as he grew in aptitude, the normally jovial attitude he exhibited changed into something malign. Erratic outbursts of violence. Willingness to harm others for the most inconsequential of reasons. Abusing his fortune to come out on top at the expense of everyone around him. By the time we realized we had a problem on our hands, it was too late: we saw him beating his own forcibly mutated protege into a pulp, with unhinged glee all over his face." -Principal Patrocle, on the trial and execution of Archmage Loukas
The power of chaos and randomness. Practitioners have little to no control over the outcome of their spells. They merely channel their power toward their target. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Practitioners are usually immune to the effect of their own spells and the influence of this dominion. Instead their influence usually impacts those around them, often unintentionally. Accidents are more common, and others are more apt to take rash actions. Many practitioners are gamblers, not because this dominion helps them, instead it negatively impacts those gambling against them. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable practitioners include Carnivean, apprentice to Kylorin.

TEXT.English: Creation Mana
TEXT.French: Mana de Création
TEXT.German: Mana der Schöpfung
TEXT.Italian: Mana della Creazione
TEXT.Spanish: Creation Mana

TEXT.English:
"By Amathaon, this is... perfect. I always felt you were a blessing in my life. And to see you blessed by Him... don't tell your friends. Please. The moment people find out, they will try to abuse your gifts. Let me figure something out first. I hope the Emperor will take favor on you. Under his tutelage you'll flourish more than you could otherwise. And know I'll always be proud of you." -Majen's father, upon seeing his son's painting
The power to bring something new into the world. From the minor ability to transform a like substance to another, to making something out of nothing. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is the rarest dominion. It is so rare that practitioners often don't ever realize they are mages. Instead they are frequently alchemists or herbalists that believe their creations are the result of the ingredients and preparation, when it is their magical ability that is producing the effect. Practitioners are often gifted artists, painters, writers and sculptures. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable practitioners include Majen, apprentice to Kylorin and fantastical Toy Maker.

TEXT.English: Death Mana
TEXT.French: Mana de Mort
TEXT.German: Mana des Todes
TEXT.Italian: Mana della Morte
TEXT.Spanish: Maná de Muerte

TEXT.English:
"Death by itself is not a sphere that should be shunned, you are right. With proper use, it allows us to calm the restless spirits of the dead, investigate murders, and ensure the old can make way for the new. But the reason we shun and regulate it anyway is because of its ease of abuse. Anyone can twist it into raising the dead, chaining them in a hideous existence where they can only feel agony. This is why we imprisoned Sammuel. Death is not a form of Magic that should be taken lightly. Remember this before you make your oath." -Archmage Hektor to his new protege
Those with a minor affinity often make great investigators. They can often sense places where people have died, and people or items that have taken lives. They can detect information from a corpse, often including the last things they experienced before death. Most cultures view manipulating death as immoral, so many practitioners avoid that. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]No one is born with death affinity. Instead it is found in those that suffer some traumatic event early in life. Those gifted in this dominion are generally barren. Many practitioners use the ability to manipulate death to create perversions of the dead, but moral practitioners can be just as powerful. These two groups often war with each other. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable practitioners include Barbatos the Lich.

TEXT.English: Dimensional Mana
TEXT.French: Mana Dimensionnel
TEXT.German: Mana der Dimensionsmagie
TEXT.Italian: Mana Dimensionale
TEXT.Spanish: Dimensional Mana

TEXT.English:
"For Oghma's sake, never fall asleep in Archmage Drahm's class. EVER. Under any circumstances. Sleep before class, collapse after it, but NEVER during his. That man has an evil sense of humor. And he DESPISES it when you disrespect the relationship between mentor and student. One time, I saw Teleris drop from exhaustion, and the next thing we knew, he was sent RIGHT into Stella's bedchambers. Yes, that's Tyr's protege. He ended up her plaything for the rest of our semester." -Adept Morin
This is the power of the between, that which binds things together. At its weakest practitioners are able to see the relationship between objects (a key and a lock) while the more powerful are able to change these relationships which is most famously used to change the location of objects (teleport, changing the relationship between you and the room you are into that of another room). Unusual uses for the dominion include changing the bond between parent and child (to influence birthright curses), or creating a bond between objects for voodoo type magic. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Practitioners frequently hear voices and whispers. Many occasionally see objects as other things (seeing a child as a grandparent, an old clock as a tree, a diplomats letter as a bloody knife, etc). They appear as if they have schizophrenia. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable practitioner include Os-Gabella and Gosea the Dwindling.

TEXT.French: Mana de Terre
TEXT.German: Mana der Erde
TEXT.Italian: Mana della Terra
TEXT.Spanish: Maná de Tierra

TEXT.English:
"Oh, Korven? He's a bit of a stick-up, if you ask me. We don't get along that well, especially because he's the Earth class's top student. Very reliable and conscientious, though! Anything he does, he puts his fullest diligence into it. And he always makes sure everything is done with care. I just feel he needs to let loose every once in a while, you know? ... Wait. What do you mean he's the Khazad emmissaries' favorite in parties!? No way he has me beat in the fun department, I'll show him I can hold my alcohol better than he does-" -Adept Morin
The source of this power comes from the world itself. It is strengthened in contact with massive blocks of stone, weakened when standing on dirt or cut blocks and practitioners lose all affinity for this dominion if they aren't in contact with the earth at all. Being in a tree, on a horse, or simply held up in the air by someone else will negate their ability. But when in contact the practitioner can call on all aspects of the world to either imbue themselves with these aspects or transform the earth and stone around them. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Because their power comes from contact with the earth many practitioners of this dominion choose not to wear shoes. Their magic will work through the short distance, but it is weakened. Because of their affinity and because their feet are in direct contact with the earth they can often sense anyone walking nearby. Masters of this dominion stop needing to breathe and can be mistaken for being dead, which isn't helped by the fact that they sometimes bury themselves when meditating. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Jenkin, apprentice to Kylorin, and born outside of Erebus.

TEXT.English:
"Ugh, Flavius. Not only he's a typical Bannor, but he's utterly autistic too- I don't mean that as an insult!! Let me explain! His problem is keep going on and on about virtue this, virtue that, it's like having good character is the only thing in his mind at all times! And his class is more like a military academy!! And worst of all, he has nothing but contempt for Drahm. If it weren't for our Principal, I'm dead sure he'd turn this Hall into a battlefield. At least he's a master at his craft. And he's more reasonable in his off hours, thank Oghma..." -Adept Morin
This dominion never works overtly. Instead the aspects of objects are enhanced by it. Without other dominions, only existing aspects can be heightened, a wall can be made stronger, a sword sharper. But with ties with fire a sword can be given a burning blade, or with darkness a charm can be made to hide the wearer. These spells take complex rituals and days, weeks, months or years to cast depending on their complexity. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Practitioners of this dominion are typically collectors of obscure and varied objects. They can sense the affinity an object has for a dominion and they are quick to gather ones with a strong affinity because it makes enchanting them in that dominion much easier. A practitioner skilled in this dominion and death is likely to have a morbid collection of items strong with death affinity nearby, murderer's knives, gravedigger's shovel, pieces of gravestones, hangman's noose, etc. They occasionally find affinity for an item that they don't expect (a key with a strong affinity for mind magic) and can spend a lot of time trying to research the history of the object to find out why. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Beeri Bawl and Velgyr, apprentice to Kylorin and creator of the Crucible and the Clockwork City.

TEXT.French: Mana d'Entropie
TEXT.German: Mana der Entropie
TEXT.Italian: Mana dell'Entropia
TEXT.Spanish: Maná de Entropía

TEXT.English:
"Fulton, I speak to you as a friend about this. If you keep studying Entropy Magic like that, you'll not just be in contravention of Amurite Law. I'm breaking my oath of secrecy here, but I'll say it anyway: Entropy's manifestation in your journal's third entry? It's a display of Agares's insidious influence in Creation. This is not entropy the way the Mechanos define it. If you keep going deeper, the moment you realize Entropy actually means Despair? You'll already be in his clutches, and I'll have to put you down. Don't make me do this." -Principal Patrocle to Archmage Fulton
This dominion focuses on the unmaking, ruin and destruction of objects, people, and society. Not by overwhelming power, but by finding and intensifying the targets inherent flaws. This power often works unintentionally, flowers wither, clothes unravel, food spoils. Just because a practitioner is around. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Practitioners are often unable to maintain relationships, they see the flaws in others to closely. They become solitary and depressed, often suicidal. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Asmoday, apprentice to Kylorin and son of Sallos.

TEXT.English: Fire Mana
TEXT.French: Mana de Feu
TEXT.German: Mana des Feuers
TEXT.Italian: Mana del Fuoco
TEXT.Spanish: Maná de Fuego

TEXT.English:
"Most people only understand what Fire Magic can do physically. Fireballs, bursts of wild energy, the ability to burn down any obstacle on your path. Few understand what it does to your soul. It inflames passions, it drives you to reckless excitement. All I wished to do as an adept is go out, do things. Not study what I thought were dusty old tomes and listen to droning lectures. And that same excitement made me... that Elven woman and her son and daughter still haunt me in my dreams. I am always thankful for Sirona's grace. Her forgiveness and temperance are the only things granting me peace." -Corindale's journal, after his acceptance into the Elohim
The power to channel and control fire also applies to rapid change and mutation. There is often great power in these transformations, but they are temporary and often leave the target weaker or even destroyed by the experience. Practitioners that internalize their power often consume an external source to feed it (fire, hatred or physical matter that they reduce to ash) so that they aren't destroyed by it. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Practitioners of this dominion are very passionate, as artists, lovers or they are violent. They are often very driven individuals, those obsessively pursuing their goals and the disenfranchised looking to launch a rebellion. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Mikel Dylantyr, apprentice to Kylorin.

TEXT.English:
"As all of you know, outside of my duties as principal, I am also the resident tutor in Force Magic. Most of you simply know that Force is the sphere that counters all other magic. Few of you know the why: Magic at its core is the imbalancing of the spheres to achieve the desired outcome. Force's anti-magical nature is because it reasserts that balance, ensuring nothing oversteps its boundary. Some of you know where I'm getting at. But for the rest of you, once you come out of this class, no one will exert their will on you without your consent ever again." -Principal Patrocle, class introduction
This is the power of the immutable. The power of authority and judgement. Magic is performed as "Decrees", the Decree of Eternal Vigilance compels someone to protect the target with their life. The Decree of Silence keeps someone from ever speaking about a subject and the Decree of Sanctity keeps the target from entering a specific location. Decrees can apply to people or inanimate objects. Powerful practitioners can have decrees that impact the entire world. A "wall of force" isn't a physical construct, it is a decree that nothing can pass the area that is applied to the entire world. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Many practitioners of this dominion are mute. They tend to be open minded and thoughtful, but once they make a decision, they are slow to move off of it. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Paimon of the Luonnotar, apprentice to Kylorin.

TEXT.English: [TAB][TAB]"Ugh, if I hear that old windbag go on and on again about kids these days..." [TAB]"Ha, look at you! Told ya Borios would suck the life out of you!" [TAB][TAB]"Yeah, no way I'm taking up his class. Serves me right thinking Ice was a cool sphere, I can see what it did to him. No way I'm turning into that curmudgeon." [TAB]"Hahaha, you can say that again!! I can see you shivering too. Told you to pick up a thick sweater! Have you considered my Air class offer, by the way?" [TAB][TAB]"Yeah, I decided to refuse, sorry. I already settled on something." [TAB]"Please don't tell me you're going for Flavius's class." [TAB][TAB]"Morin, I always had to be the proper one to cover for your antics. And I have affinity for it. Flavius said as much!" [TAB]"Ugh, at this point you might as well have gone for Ice anyway..." [NEWLINE]-Adept Morin and his younger brother [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] This is the force of stasis, of unchanging. It can also be a force for calm or slow recovery (like a coma). A little power can cause things to slow, and strong practitioners can cause natural processes to stop entirely. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Practitioners become dogmatic, resistant to new ideas or reform. They love tradition and take comfort in rituals and habits. They tend to be conservative in all things. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Badb, apprentice to Kylorin, and able to move through Blizzards.

TEXT.English: Law Mana
TEXT.French: Mana de Loi
TEXT.German: Mana der Ordnung
TEXT.Italian: Mana della Legge
TEXT.Spanish: Maná de Ley

TEXT.English:
"Have you ever sat through a Law class? Here's a tip: don't. It makes Flavius look downright carefree. The tutor there has the stick welded into his ass, his students are utterly humorless, and even trying to do the magic will turn you madder than a Balseraph. Ever wanted to feel the stress of your life performing a ritual while trying to not mess up the tiniest detail? Even the Luchuirp's finest watches aren't this requiring of precision. Anyone who gets off on perfect order might as well be Undertow Asylum material to me." -Adept Morin
This dominion is the power of justice and equity. It punishes inequity, corruption and randomness. Law frequently gives power equal to any just challenge, but no more. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Practitioners tend to be obsessive compulsive in some aspect of their lives. They are reliable administrators but may be inflexible. Practitioners are the most powerful when standing against corruption. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Soqed Hozi, apprentice to Kylorin.

TEXT.English: Life Mana
TEXT.French: Mana de Vie
TEXT.German: Mana des Lebens
TEXT.Italian: Mana della Vita
TEXT.Spanish: Maná de Vida

TEXT.English:
"First question: how many of you have been made fun of for taking this class? Well, that's a lot of you. I won't sugarcoat this: the ridicule won't end. Many think picking Life is taking the coward's way, where you only heal ailments and stay away from trouble. But these people are wrong. Life isn't just about that. It's about steeling yourself and making sure you can tackle the hardest challenges. It's about giving yourself the power to fight for what you believe in, no matter the hardship. Oh, what about me, you ask? I live for my family. I'd do everything for them." -Archmage Mirthan, class introduction
Minor practitioners can influence fertility and help speed healing. More powerful can perform miraculous healing or extend life. Practitioners can also sense back through generations of a subject, sensing who assessors are, and bringing out their assets in their descendant. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Practitioners are often conceived without sex. Those conceived like this often have high affinity. Practitioners are often drawn to those that are suffering, though they are often sought by powerful men as a balm against disease and old age. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Leucetios, apprentice to Kylorin and daughter of Nemed.

TEXT.English: Metamagic Mana
TEXT.French: Mana de Métamagie
TEXT.German: Mana der Metamagie
TEXT.Italian: Mana Metamagico
TEXT.Spanish: Maná Metamágico

TEXT.English:
"Every human being has the potential to become something more within them. Allowing them to express their inner talents is the greatest gift you could bestow to them. Look at the people I took in my tutelage: the children who used to beg now support others like them. The aspiring athlete is now the aspiration for his peers. That young lady who wanted to inspire her beloved now inspires her home town to do more than they thought they could. Keeping such knowledge away only reinforces unnatural imbalances of power. Humanity will never reach greatness as long as this persists." -Govannon, when asked about why he disapproves of his peers
This dominion focuses on the nature of magic itself. It is most commonly used to detect and identify magic. Though at moderate levels it can be used to break and disrupt spells and at the highest levels it can be used to transform magic, or the way it works. A master in this dominion can create an area where magic doesn't work, move an enchantment from one object to another, or trap a magical creature in an object. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This dominion has to be accessed through symbols, runes and ritual. Practitioners spend long hours studying to understand these complex interactions much as a chemist studies chemistry. This makes for bookish, arcane sorts. Unusually there are varied types of this dominion that seem to have little connection to each other. One may understand magical interactions through precise mathematical drawings, another through colorful mandala, other through carvings on elaborate 3 dimensional objects. These all have the same result, but students of each have little to learn from each other. It appears that any way it is envisioned it is only an interpretation for the true nature of magic, and practitioners can only hope to learn by continuing to learn more about their particular interpretation. Learning another is like starting over. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Auric Ulvin, Govannon and Gastrius, apprentice to Kylorin.
TEXT.French:
"Every human being has the potential to become something more within them. Allowing them to express their inner talents is the greatest gift you could bestow to them. Look at the people I took in my tutelage: the children who used to beg now support others like them. The aspiring athlete is now the aspiration for his peers. That young lady who wanted to inspire her beloved now inspires her home town to do more than they thought they could. Keeping such knowledge away only reinforces unnatural imbalances of power. Humanity will never reach greatness as long as this persists." -Govannon, when asked about why he disapproves of his peers

TEXT.French: Mana de Pensée
TEXT.German: Mana des Geistes
TEXT.Italian: Mana della Mente
TEXT.Spanish: Maná de Mente

TEXT.English:
"Every Mind mage with good intentions starts the same. They wish to push their minds to greater heights, to reach a level of prowess that will help them to innovations unmatched by their peers. But soon enough, they too will join their less benevolent brethren. All minds eventually fray: some will seek to control everything in their lives. Others will be overcome with a rapacity the likes unlike their former natures. And a rare few, they will lose all sanity, the madness overtaking them beyond Sirona's reach. But even that can be mended." -an Apostle to her Devout protege
The power of memory and thought. Practitioners can read minds and protect their thoughts from the same. The more powerful can manipulate the memories of their targets or dominate them entirely. There are a wide range of effects that can be caused by this dominion, from becoming "invisible" by causing on target to fail to notice you, to implanting thoughts (you should go out on patrol), or mistaking the senses (that stick is a snake). The effects typically require concentration to maintain the effect. This dominion is largely ineffective against those whose minds are significantly different than the practitioners (so a human would be unable to affect animals or angels). Exposure to others minds often causes befuddlement or confusion in the practitioner. They are often unable to simply cause the change they want and will expose themselves to other thoughts or memories of their targets. Practitioners who use the power to frequently may begin to dream as if they were their target, or have odd memories from the lives of those they have influenced. Many go insane. Others suffer dementia where their memories become lost in sea of others. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Perpentach.

TEXT.English:
"I'm tellin' ya, all the best looking girls seem to congregate on the Nature class. Don't ask me why, your guess is as good as mine. But much as I'd like to try my luck asking one out for a date, I don't think I'd be able to sit still while one of the animals they interact with during practice. One of them even bonded with a panther... the break up would turn me into its next meal. Oh please, even I have a sense of danger!" -Adept Morin
The power of slow growth. The power of the forest and the remote corners of the world. They can sense the life of a region and commune with plants and animals. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Affinity is strongly based on the practitioners environment, being nearly powerless in urban areas and powerful in the deep forest. Practitioners often have a specific type of plant or animal that they bond with. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Arendel Phaedra, Talia Gosam and Herve.

TEXT.English: It was the last day of my apprenticeship, the first day I could claim the title Adept. My master brought me to this hilltop and sat. By his silence, I knew he was awaiting the answer to an unasked question. This time, as usual, I didn't know what was expected of me. I looked around, searching. After a time, as he continued to gaze at me, I grew frustrated. I was about to speak, to ask for the riddle so I could begin to answer it, when suddenly I felt-nay, tasted the glorious stuff for the first time. The Ether. My eyes betrayed my ecstasy, and my master smirked knowingly. He arched his eyebrow. I answered, finally, with one word. "Power."

Durch sein Schweigen wusste ich, dass er eine Antwort auf eine unausgesprochene Frage erwartete. Wie immer wusste ich nicht, was von mir erwartet wurde, also schaute ich mich suchend um. Nach einer Weile, während er mich fortwährend anstarrte, wurde ich ungeduldig. Ich öffnete meine Lippen, um nach der Aufgabe fragen, da spürte  nein kostete  ich es plötzlich zum ersten Mal. Den Äther. Mein Augen müssen meine Verzückung verraten haben, den mein Meister grinste vielsagend. Erwartungsvoll hob er seine Augenbrauen und ich antwortete mit einem einzigen Wort: "Macht".
TEXT.Italian: Era l'ultimo giorno del mio apprendistato, il primo giorno in cui potevo fregiarmi del titolo di Adepto. Il mio maestro mi portò su questa collina e si sedette. Dal suo silenzio sapevo che stava aspettando una risposta a una domanda non posta. Quella volta, come al solito, non sapevo cosa si apettasse da me. Io guardavo in giro, cercando. Dopo un pò, mentre continuava a fissarmi, diventavo sempre più frustrato. Stavo per parlare, per chiedere quale fosse l'indovinello cosi da poter rispondere, quando all'improvviso percepii per la prima volta la sensazione gloriosa dell'etere. I miei occhi tradirono la mia estasi, e il mio maestro sorrise compiaciuto. Lui arcuò le sopracciglia. Io risposi, finalmente, con una parola. "Potere."

TEXT.English:
"A word of advice about the Shadow Magic class: don't even waste your time studying for the final. It's nearly impossible for even experienced mages. The real final exam is if you can steal a copy of the answers without Lyn noticing. And don't expect this to be easy - she's nearly as sadistic as Drahm when it comes to mean tricks. Take it from me, I learned to not trust a word she says or even believe things are how they are at face value. Hell, if you trust me, I could swipe the answers for you for a fee. Do you?" -Adept Morin
This is the power of deception, hiding and illusion. Unlike other dominions that give the power to detect their power, that is not granted through shadow. A practitioner can create illusions of size and complexity depending on his affinity. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Many practitioners lose their affinity during the day. Nearly all practitioners have increased ability to see in darkness. Many with an affinity for this dominion see things that aren't real. Occasionally it is as strong as full hallucinations, but more commonly they are simply people moving in the shadows, something standing at the edge of the bed, or something glimpsed out of the corner of the eye that isn't really there [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Gibbon Goetia and Wode, Apprentice to Kylorin.

TEXT.Italian: Mana dello Spirito

TEXT.English:
"I don't know how Leah does it. Her ability to maintain composure no matter how infuriating a situation is scares me. Oh, you didn't know? She's from Elohim lands. She came here to tutor Spirit Magic as part of this new treaty. And she knows how to calm any spat before it goes out of hand. Her kindly gaze is unforgettable. Oh, you didn't hear it from me, but Tyr seems to have eyes on her. Everyone else thinks it'll distract her from her, well, you know what I mean. But me? I just want to see how many will lose their minds when they declare their intentions." -Adept Morin
This is the power of emotion, of hope and fear, of compassion and anger. It is the power that reminds us that our bodies are a thin veil for the soul that lies within us. Bodies that will break down when we experience true loss, and unable to stand under overwhelming grief. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Twins are more likely to be gifted in this dominion. Blindness increases a practitioners affinity so it is more common in this dominion. Some practitioners blind themselves on purpose for this reason. Practitioners often unintentionally affect the emotions of those around them, because of that, they make good performers. Some practitioners have more powerful impact over those they love, some have more impact over those they hate [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Ethne the White (Eve), and Laroth, apprentice to Kylorin.

TEXT.English:
"Of all the weapons the Malakim wield, none are as troublesome and dangerous as their Sun mages. Not only do they harness their talents to prevent our assassins from killing their commanders, they're also used to target our lords and strip them of all their power before killing them with contemptuous ease. If you find one, you will not take quarter, you will not let him act. Above all, you will not even let him speak his poison. If I hear any of you let even one of them flee, I will impale you as an example to the rest. You will not fail our Queen. None of Lugus's accursed followers deserve to live." -unknown Calabim commander to his Moroi
This is the power of revelation and spiritual truth. At modest levels it can destroy illusions and force the truth out of someone, and at the most powerful it can tear away everything false from a target, both physically and emotionally. It can strike those that refuse to see the truth blind, turn strong but insecure men into burnt reflections of their spiritual selves, and shock a rioting mob into seeing exactly what they have become. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Telling lies weakens the power of a practitioner over this dominion. To the point that they can lose it entirely. Those that are completely open for years can reach amazing levels of power, but that is rare to find. Many casters are powerless at night, or when they are not in direct sunlight. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Chalid Astrakein, Varn Gosam and Tamesis, apprentice to Kylorin.

TEXT.English: "HORATIUS: What element could be mightier than water? It extinguishes the flames when all others perish before them. It gnaws ceaselessly at the earth, never tiring til in time it has worn even the greatest mountain down to the smallest speck of sand. Even the wind is its servant, scattering raindrops so that all may know its manifold blessings. With such power at our call, what threat could ever endanger our glorious republic?"[PARAGRAPH:2][ITALICS]Excerpt from The Vanity of the Aifons, Bernado Juvenal[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The force of the ocean is also the power of dreams, sleep and madness. Their power is strengthened with contact with water, but most are able to draw off of the moisture in the air and in their own bodies to cast. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In the Age of Rebirth, most practitioners struggle with horrific nightmares. The intensity increases with their affinity with this dominion. Ironically many gifted with affinity in this dominion are afraid of water, either that fear or an early trauma with water seems to have deepened their connection. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Notable Practitioners include Hannah the Irin, Hemah and Trenton Majosi, apprentice to Kylorin.

TEXT.English: [TAB]First discovered in the Age of Magic, Mithril is stronger and lighter than steel. Dwarves, the first to discover it, used to spread the rumor that the white metal was actually carved dragon bone and laughed as their competition marched off into dragon lairs to attempt to recover some. Today the tradition continues, but since the lairs hold many of the artifacts created during the Age of Magic, those lucky enough to survive the raids are often rewarded with the Mithril they were hunting. Its resistance to magic also makes it the metal of choice for mage hunters of all types.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Découvert d'abord à l'Âge de Magie, le mithril est plus solide et plus clair que l'acier. Les nains, les premier à le découvrir, prirent l'habitude de répandre la rumeur que le métal blanc était de l'os de dragon sculpté et rirent de cette compétition à aller dans les repaires de dragon pour essayer d'en récupérer. Aujourd'hui la tradition continue, mais depuis que les trésors de dragons contiennent beaucoup d'objets fabriqués durant l'Âge de Magie, ceux assez fortunés pour survivre aux raids sont souvent récompensés avec le mithril qu'ils recherchaient.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Im Zeitalter der Magie entdeckt, ist Mithril härter und leichter als Stahl. Die Zwerge, die es entdeckten, verbreiteten das Gerücht, das weiße Metall sei geschnitzter Drachenknochen und lachten, als ihre Konkurrenz die Drachenhöhlen durchsuchten, um etwas davon zu finden. Diese Tradition besteht auch heute noch, da es aber in Drachennestern viele Artefakte zu finden gibt, die während des Zeitalters der Magie geschaffen wurden, werden die Glücklichen, die die Raubzüge überleben, oftmals mit dem Mithril ausgezeichnet, welches sie suchten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Scoperto la prima volta nell'Era della Magia il Mithril è più resistente e leggero dell'acciaio. I Nani, i primi a scoprirlo, sparsero la voce che quel metallo bianco fosse in realtà osso di drago lavorato e risero quando la concorrenza entravano nei nascondigli dei draghi cercando di recuperarne un pò. Oggi la tradizione continua, ma siccome i nascondigli contengono molti degli artefatti creati durante l'Era della Magia coloro sufficentemente fortunati a sopravvivere alle esplorazioni sono spesso ricompensati con il Mithril che stavano cercando.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Descubierto por primera vez en la Edad de la Magia, el Mithril es más fuerte y ligero que el acero. Los Enanos, sus descubridores, lo utilizaron para difundir el rumor de que el metal blanco era hueso de dragon escarbado y se regocijaron mientras su competición se adentraba en lo profundo de los cubiles de los dragones para intentar coger un poco. Hoy la tradición continúa, pero desde que los cubiles empezaron a guardar muchos artefactos creados durante la Edad de la Magia, aquellos lo suficientemente afortunados que sobreviven a las incursiones también son recompensados con el Mithril que andaban buscando.

TEXT.English: Mushrooms
TEXT.German: Pilze
TEXT.Italian: Funghi
TEXT.Spanish: Mushrooms

TEXT.English: Mushrooms are commonly picked in the wild and used as food, especially to add great flavour. They are not real plants and can survive without light, provided there is enough organic matter to feed them. As such, they are farmed underground and are a main food in the Underhome. But almost every civilization has a favoured breed of mushrooms, as during the Age of Ice, when humans and non-humans alike were often forced to live underground, mushrooms were staples of their diet.

TEXT.English: Nightmare
TEXT.French: Cauchemar
TEXT.German: Höllenpferde
TEXT.Italian: Incubo
TEXT.Spanish: Pesadilla

TEXT.English: Nightmares are a powerful breed of demonic horses, one of Camulos's many horrors. They make the best warhorses on Erebus but they eat meat and are cruel to anyone except those strong enough to master them. They lure warriors away from their camps. The warriors chase after them, hoping to capture the dark steed, only to have the nightmare turn on them and consume them. Nightmares hate normal horses and normal horses are scared of nightmares. Their emergence into Creation is a sign of hell's influence, corrupting all it touches. Death Knights use Nightmares as their steed.
TEXT.French: It's a horse. We've fought demons, dragons and liches, and you're scared of a horse? I mean, really, a horse is a horse, even in these blasted lands. I'm just gonna offer her an apple and see what happens. -Private Mortimer, last words
TEXT.German: It's a horse. We've fought demons, dragons and liches, and you're scared of a horse? I mean, really, a horse is a horse, even in these blasted lands. I'm just gonna offer her an apple and see what happens. -Private Mortimer, last words
TEXT.Italian: È un cavallo. Abbiamo combattuto demoni, draghi e lich, e tu sei spaventato da un cavallo? Intendo, sul serio, un cavallo è un cavallo, anche in queste terre devastate. Sto andando a offrirgli una mela e vedere cosa succede. -Soldato Mortimer, ultime parole
TEXT.Spanish: It's a horse. We've fought demons, dragons and liches, and you're scared of a horse? I mean, really, a horse is a horse, even in these blasted lands. I'm just gonna offer her an apple and see what happens. -Private Mortimer, last words

TEXT.English: Obsidian
TEXT.French: Obsidienne
TEXT.German: Obsidian
TEXT.Italian: Ossidiana
TEXT.Spanish: Obsidian

TEXT.English: Every now and then, the earth itself bursts open to spew lava and searing tephra at its surroundings. And ever since the fall of Bhall, this phenomenon only became more frequent and destructive. But to those able to weather such an event, they find themselves with a unique material: obsidian. Able to be sharpened to an extreme edge, it is the material of choice for various Mazatl tools and weapons, due to their proximity to Mount Kalshekk. And nations able to equip their workers with Obsidian tools find themselves outcompeting their peers in exploiting the land.
TEXT.French: Obsidian is a naturally occurring volcanic glass formed as an extrusive igneous rock. It is produced when felsic lava extruded from a volcano cools without crystal growth. Obsidian is commonly found within the margins of rhyolitic lava flows known as obsidian flows, where the chemical composition (high silica content) induces a high viscosity of the lava. Because of the lack of crystal structure, obsidian blade edges can reach incredible thinness, leading to its use as projectile points and scalpel blades.

TEXT.Italian: L'Ossidiana è un vetro vulcanico la cui formazione è dovuta al rapidissimo raffreddamento della lava acida, ovvero ad alto contenuto di ioni di silicio, i quali non riescono a raggiungere la formazione ordinata di un reticolo cristallino. Il filo delle lame in ossidiana può essere incredibilmente sottile e tagliente, portando al suo utilizzo nella creazione di oggetti taglienti (coltelli) e perforanti (punte di freccia e lancia) oltre a essere usata per oggetti decorativi.

TEXT.English: Patrian Artifacts
TEXT.French: Artefacts Patriens
TEXT.German: Patrianische Artefakte
TEXT.Italian: Artefatti di Patria
TEXT.Spanish: Patrian Artifacts

TEXT.English:
"Careful with that! The Risen Emperor has decreed all excavated material to be treated with utmost care! If any of you break even a vase, your rations of spirit mead will be withheld for a month!"
To most nations on Erebus, these artifacts are a treasure trove of knowledge to be studied and pilfered. To those old enough to have lived in that era, they are a depressing remnant of an empire of hubris manifest. To Kylorin himself, they are a reminder of his past atrocities. But to the Scions, they are more than a treasure trove: their pilfering is used to validate their claim as Patria Reborn. Just don't ask what the Amurites or the Bannor think. The former will scoff at this farce of an empire. But the latter seem to be itching for a fight, almost as if the Scions' mere existence is a personal insult...

TEXT.English: Pearls
TEXT.French: Perles
TEXT.German: Perlen
TEXT.Italian: Perle
TEXT.Spanish: Perlas

TEXT.English: [TAB]While one of many staples among the Lanun, other nations consider it more of a delicacy. Along the Lanun, it is often a custom for one to make a deep dive in the seas, and collect as many as possible before having to go to the surface for air - the one with the biggest number gets free drinks from his buddies for the day. And a few species of clam are known for their lustrous pearls, to the point it's one of the most lucrative trades among many a Lanun captain. One necklace made by pearls from a species of clam cultivated by Undertow Cultists is one of Hannah the Irin's most treasured possessions.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une concrétion de coquillage, habituellement arrondie, et possédant un éclat brillant, avec les teintes variables, trouvée dans la valve, ou entre la valve et la coquille d'huîtres perlières et de mulettes d'eau douce. C'est généralement du à la sécrétion d'une substance autour d'une particule étrangère irritante. Sa substance est la même que la nacre ou le burgau. Les perles qui sont rondes, ou presque rondes, et d'un bel éclat, sont hautement estimées comme les bijoux, et sont d'une valeur comparable à celle des pierres précieuses.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine schalige, normalerweise rundliche Absonderung mit einem schimmernden Glanz in wechselnden Farbtönen. Sie werden in der Umhüllung oder zwischen Hülle und Schale von Perlenaustern oder Flussmuscheln gefunden. Gewöhnlich handelt es sich dabei um Schalensubstanz, die sich um einen Fremdpartikel legt, und die das gleiche wie Perlmutt ist. Perlen, die kugelrund sind, oder fast kugelrund, und einen edlen Glanz haben, werden als Juwelen hoch geschätzt und sind im Wert vergleichbar mit edlen Steinen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Le perle sono di solito rotonde, e hanno una lucentezza brillante, con vari colori, e si trova nel mantello o tra il mantello e il guscio dei molluschi (in particolare delle ostriche). La perla non è altro che un corpo estraneo che viene ricoperto di madreperla per proteggere i tessuti dell'animale dall'irritazione. Le pearle che sono particolarmente sferiche, e di raffinata lucentezza, sono molto apprezzate come gioielli e sono simili come valore alle pietre preziose.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A shelly concretion, normalmente redonda, y con un lustre brillante, con varios tonos, se encuentran en el manto, o entre el manto y la concha de ostras y moluscos de río. Se debe normalmente a la secreción de una sustancia alrededor de una partícula externa irritada. Su sustancia es la misma que el nácar, o madreperla. Las perlas que son redondas, o aproximadamente redondas, y con un lustre fino, son consideradas joyas de alta estima, y comparable al valor de algunas piedras preciosas.

TEXT.English: Razorweed
TEXT.French: Herbelame
TEXT.German: Klingengras
TEXT.Italian: Erba Rasoio
TEXT.Spanish: Hierbacortante

TEXT.English: [TAB]Sometimes called "Bloodweed" or "Assassin's Gift," Razorweed is a horrid plant that first grew in hell. It was later taken into creation, though difficult to grow in captivity because of its unruly habit of killing its gardener. That tendency made it a favorite gift of assassins, who would sneak it into their victims gardens, where, once it had grown to maturity, the plant would perform the assassins work.[NEWLINE][TAB]Composed mostly of vines with strong, hollow thorns along its length, dark sacs of blood can blossom along its length after feeding.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Parfois appelée "herbesang" ou "cadeau de lassassin", lherbelame est une horrible plante qui poussa tout dabord en enfer. Elle fut importée plus tard dans la création, bien que difficile à faire pousser en captivité car elle tue en général son jardinier. Cette tendance en a fait lun des cadeaux favoris des assassins, qui se cache dans le jardin des victimes et les tue quand elle a assez grandi.[NEWLINE][TAB]La plante elle-même est principalement constituée de lianes grimpantes parsemées de dures épines. Lorsquelle sest nourrie, de sombres poches de sang peuvent fleurir sur toute sa longueur.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das manchmal auch "Blutgras" oder "Geschenk an die Mörder" genannte Klingengras ist eine abscheuliche Pflanze, die zuerst in der Hölle wuchs. Später wurde sie dann gezüchtet, obwohl sie schwierig anzubauen war - denn in der Regel tötete sie ihre Gärtner. Diese Eigenart machte sie für Attentäter zu einem bevorzugten "Präsent" - sie pflanzten heimlich ein Exemplar im Garten des Opfers, das ihn töten würde sobald es nur groß genug geworden war.[NEWLINE][TAB]Die Pflanze an sich besteht zum Großteil aus Reben, mit stabilen, hohlen Dornen. Nach dem Verspeisen von Beute können dunkle Blutsäcke auf ihr gedeihen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A volte chiamata "Erba del sangue" o "Regalo dell'Assassino", l'Erba Rasoio è un orrida pianta che prima cresceva solo all'inferno. È stata poi inserità nella creazione, anche se difficile da coltivare a causa della sua abitudine di uccidere il suo giardiniere. Questa tendenza la ha resa il regalo preferito degli assassini, che la inseriscono di nascosto nel giardino delle loro vittime, dove, una volta cresciuta abbastanza, compiera il lavoro dell'assassino.[NEWLINE][TAB]Composta principalmente di viticci con spesse spine cave lungo tutta la loro lunghezza. Sacche scure di sangue possono sbocciare lungo tutta la pianta dopo essersi nutrita.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Denominada a veces "Hierba Sangrienta" u "Obsequio del Asesino", la Hierbacortante es una planta horrible que creció primero en el infierno. Después fue traída a la creación, aunque es difícil de plantar en cautividad porque normalmente podría matar a su jardinero. Esa tendencia la convirtió en un regalo preferido por los asesinos, que se infiltraría en los jardines de sus víctimas donde los acabaría matando cuando creciera lo suficientemente largo.[NEWLINE][TAB]La planta en sí es principalmente un conjunto de vides con espinas fuertes y huecas a lo largo de ella. Después de alimentarse de bolsas oscuras de sangre puede florecer.

TEXT.English: Reagents
TEXT.French: Réactifs
TEXT.German: Reagenzien
TEXT.Italian: Reagenti
TEXT.Spanish: Reactivos

TEXT.English: [TAB]Reagents are plants that are specially tended and prepared to be used in spellcasting. The caster taps into the latent magical energy in the reagents and is able to access more powerful spells, as he doesn't have to rely on just the power developed in his or her own body.
TEXT.French: Les réactifs sont des plantes qui sont spécialement entretenues et préparées pour être utilisées pour lancer des sorts. Le lanceur puise dans l'énergie magique latente contenue dans les réactifs et ainsi est capable de lancer des sorts plus puissants car il n'a plus à compter sur son seul corps comme focus.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Reagenzien sind Pflanzen, die sehr gut für die Zauberei geeignet sind. Wenn ein Zauberer die verborgene Magie innerhalb dieser Pflanzen anzapft, kann er mächtigere Sprüche benutzen, da er auf mehr als nur seinen eigenen Körper als Fokus zurückgreifen kann.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I reagenti sono piante che sono specificatamente coltivate e lavorate per essere usate nel lancio di magie. L'incantatore attinge alla magia latente dei ragenti ed è capace di lanciare magie più potenti, cosi da non dover fare affidamento solo sul potere sviluppato dal suo corpo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los Reactivos son plantas que son especialmente preparadas para el lanzamiento de hechizos. El lanzador explota la energía mágica latente en los reactivos y es capaz de acceder a hechizos más poderosos debido a ello, ya que no tiene que recurrir a su propio cuerpo como foco.
